title: PHPExceptiongetPrevious() Method

metadata.description: Learn about PHPExceptiongetPrevious() Method with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
Example
content_sections.code:
<?php
try {
try {
throw new Exception("An 
  error occurred", 1);
} catch(Exception $e1) {
throw new Exception("Another error occurred", 2, $e1);
}
} 
  catch (Exception $e2) {
echo $previous = $e2->getPrevious();
echo $previous->getMessage();
}
?>

practice_exercises.solution:
<?php
try {
try {
throw new Exception("An 
  error occurred", 1);
} catch(Exception $e1) {
throw new Exception("Another error occurred", 2, $e1);
}
} 
  catch (Exception $e2) {
echo $previous = $e2->getPrevious();

summary: This tutorial covers PHPExceptiongetPrevious() Method concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPExceptiongetPrevious() Method effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PHPExceptiongetPrevious() Method and how to apply it in your projects.
